Authors:
Marcin Piwczyński, Radosław Puchałka, Dominika Wyborska,
Joanna Gołębiewska, Mehrnoush Panahi, Łukasz Banasiak, Krzysztof
Spalik
Title:
Phylogenetic positions of 19 rare and endemic species of
Ferula L. (Apiaceae) with remarks on phylogenetic utility of trnS-trnG,
trnH-psbA and atpB-rbcL chloroplast markers
Journal: Botanical Journal of the Linnaean Society
Abstract:
Ferula L. is one of the species richest and taxonomically
difficult genera of Apiaceae. However, only half of described species
were studied by molecular methods to date. In this study, therefore, we
obtained nrDNA ITS sequences for one species of Dorema and eighteen
poorly known species of Ferula and explored their phylogenetic position
using over hundred ITS sequences from GenBank. In addition, we obtained
trnH-psbA, trnS-trnG and atpB-rbcL regions for subset of 18 specimens in
order to estimate their potential phylogenetic utility in the genus. In
spite of low resolution of ITS-based tree, the seventeen species were
distributed in three well-supported clades. Nine species fell into the
first clade which among others included all species of Dorema. Six
species from this genus were recently transferred to Ferula.
Consequently, we transferred additional two D. sabulosum and D.
kopetdaghense. In second clade three and in the third five were placed,
while two species were left unassigned. We discuss the position of these
taxa in light of traditional taxonomy of the genus. The analysis of
potentially highly variable intergenic spacers showed that all of them
are characterized by low number of substitutions and peculiar evolution
in comparison with ITS. We argue, therefore, that their utility in
reconstructing phylogeny of Ferula is restricted.
